DataElement.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Publisher Author Reference Text ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A document, memo or brief that enumerates the differences between two versions of a study protocol document. OTHER NAME(S): Amendment A text block containing publishing and authoring information that allows receivers of this document version to refer appropriately to this document version. EXAMPLE(S): Good Health Hospital IRB Minutes, 18-Jan-2008

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Publisher Author Reference Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A person or firm engaged in publishing periodicals or books or music.:The writer of a book, article, or other text.:A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.:The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person or firm engaged in publishing periodicals or books or music.:The writer of a book, article, or other text.:A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.:The words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A person or firm engaged in publishing periodicals or books or music.
The writer of a book, article, or other text.
A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.
